IP2025054_syn_1:
Indication: LUL NSCLC (nonsurgical).
Nav: superDimension + REBUS + CBCT.
Action: MWA (Emprint, 65W, 360s).
Complication: Pneumothorax.
Intervention: 10Fr pigtail catheter placed under fluoro.
Plan: Admit.
IP2025054_syn_2: PROCEDURE: Electromagnetic navigation bronchoscopy (superDimension) was employed to access a peripheral LUL nodule. Localization was verified with radial EBUS and cone-beam CT. Microwave ablation was performed using the Emprint system (65W, 360s). Post-procedural imaging revealed a left apical pneumothorax. A 10 French pigtail thoracostomy tube was inserted using fluoroscopic guidance without difficulty.
IP2025054_syn_3:
Codes: 31641 (Bronchial tumor destruction), 31627 (Navigational bronchoscopy), 31654 (REBUS), 32557 (Pleural drainage with image guidance).
Justification: MWA constitutes tumor destruction. Navigation and REBUS were utilized. The pneumothorax required a separate procedure (chest tube) involving imaging guidance.
IP2025054_syn_4:
Procedure: EMN Bronch + MWA + Chest Tube
Patient: [REDACTED]
Steps:
1. Navigated to LUL nodule with superDimension.
2. Confirmed with REBUS/CBCT.
3. Microwave ablation done.
4. Patient developed pneumothorax.
5. Placed pigtail chest tube.
Plan: Admit, watch chest tube.
IP2025054_syn_5: Teresa is here for ablation of that LUL spot. Used the superdimension and the cone beam to find it. Microwave antenna went in 65 watts for 6 minutes. She coughed up a little blood and then we saw a pneumo on the scan. Had to put in a pigtail catheter 10 french. She is going to the floor for monitoring.
IP2025054_syn_6: EMN-guided microwave ablation of left upper lobe peripheral nodule. Patient is a 60-year-old female with small presumed primary NSCLC. superDimension EMN platform used to access 14 mm LUL anterior segment nodule. Radial EBUS showed eccentric view; cone-beam CT confirmed antenna in lesion. Emprint microwave antenna delivered; ablation performed. Mild hemoptysis and small left apical pneumothorax requiring 10 Fr pigtail catheter occurred. Admitted to monitored bed.
IP2025054_syn_7:
[Indication]
LUL NSCLC, nonsurgical candidate.
[Anesthesia]
General.
[Description]
Navigated to LUL. Confirmed position. MWA performed (65W). Complicated by pneumothorax. 10Fr pigtail placed.
[Plan]
Admit. Monitor chest tube.
IP2025054_syn_8: We treated [REDACTED] using microwave energy today. We guided the catheter to the left upper lobe using the navigation system and confirmed it with a CT scan. The ablation went well, but she developed a small air leak (pneumothorax) afterwards. We placed a small tube in her chest to drain the air, and she is stable and being admitted for observation.
IP2025054_syn_9:
Procedure: EMN-guided microwave destruction of LUL nodule.
Details: The lesion was accessed via the superDimension platform. Ablation was executed at 65W. 
Adverse Event: Pneumothorax ensued.
Resolution: A pigtail catheter was inserted under imaging guidance. The patient was admitted.
IP2025054:
Bronchoscopic Microwave Ablation Note
Procedure: EMN-guided microwave ablation of left upper lobe peripheral nodule
Patient: [REDACTED], 60-year-old female with small presumed primary NSCLC not surgical candidate.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with 8.5 ETT.
Navigation: superDimension EMN platform used to access 14 mm LUL anterior segment nodule. Radial EBUS showed eccentric view; cone-beam CT confirmed antenna in lesion.
Ablation: Emprint microwave antenna delivered via extended working channel, 65 W for 360 seconds, peak temperature 100Â°C. Postablation CBCT demonstrated appropriate ablation zone.
Complications: Mild hemoptysis (~20 mL) and small left apical pneumothorax requiring 10 Fr pigtail catheter.
Disposition: Admitted to monitored bed.
